title: How to Marinate Olives

steps.headline: Place 2 cups (236 ml) of jarred green olives, into a large bowl, jar with a lid, or a plastic storage bag.
steps.description: Be sure to drain the olives first.

steps.headline: Add 2 cups (236 ml) of jarred black olives, drained.
Drizzle ½ cup (118 ml) of olive oil over the olives.
Pour in ¼ cup (59 ml) of red or white wine vinegar.
Mix in 2 tbsp.
steps.description: (30 ml) of minced garlic. This step is optional. Garlic gives the olives a richer, more savory flavor.

steps.headline: 4 bay leaves, ½ tsp.
steps.description: (2.5 ml) of dried rosemary, 1 tsp. (5 ml) fennel seed, and 1 tsp. (5 ml) of dried thyme.

steps.headline: Replace the vinegar with lemon juice.
Add cumin seeds, coriander seeds, crushed red pepper, and the zest of lemon and orange – all to taste.
Use paprika, peppercorns, and cumin seeds to taste.
Store olives in an air-tight container in the refrigerator for up to 2 months.

text: Steps Place 2 cups (236 ml) of jarred green olives, into a large bowl, jar with a lid, or a plastic storage bag. Be sure to drain the olives first. Add 2 cups (236 ml) of jarred black olives, drained.  Drizzle ½ cup (118 ml) of olive oil over the olives.  Pour in ¼ cup (59 ml) of red or white wine vinegar.  Mix in 2 tbsp. (30 ml) of minced garlic. This step is optional. Garlic gives the olives a richer, more savory flavor. Add seasonings to taste. Note the variations below. 4 bay leaves, ½ tsp. (2.5 ml) of dried rosemary, 1 tsp. (5 ml) fennel seed, and 1 tsp. (5 ml) of dried thyme. North African Marinade Replace the vinegar with lemon juice.  Add cumin seeds, coriander seeds, crushed red pepper, and the zest of lemon and orange – all to taste.  Spanish Marinade Use paprika, peppercorns, and cumin seeds to taste.  Store olives in an air-tight container in the refrigerator for up to 2 months.
